needleColor.title: Needle Color
needleColor.description: Give the color as a browser standard form. Either with names like 'red', 'green', etc. or as #de432b34 where two hex digits represent Red Green Blue Opacity in this order.

order.title: Draw Order
order.description: Determines the draw order of the doughnuts.

cutout.title: Doghnut Hole Size
cutout.description: How big in percent should the hole in the middle of the doughnut be? Set to 0% for Pie Chart.

sections.title: Sections
sections.description: The amount of doughnut sections. Starting from the min value, ending with the max value.

backgroundColors.title: Section background colors
backgroundColors.description: Background color for each section. This Array is one shorter than the number of sections.

chartName.title: Chart
chartName.description: If two dataseries have the same 'Chart' name, they will be drawn in the same chart. Otherwise they will get their own chart. If the name ends with #pivot# then a separat chart will be drawn for each pivoted dataseries.

averageLatest.title: Average Latest Values
averageLatest.description: Calculate the average over the given number of newest rows. (If pivoted, then per each of the pivot dataseries.) If not specified then the latest value is shown without modification.

sections.title: Data
sections.description: The Table with columns to display as sections in a Doughnut.

items.title: Sections of the Doughnut
items.description: One Doghnut ring will be drawn for the latest row in the chosen table. (If you chose averageLatest > 1, then the last 'averageLatest' rows will be aggregated to one row first.)

label.title: Section Label
label.description: Should be a chosen constant and usually not be assigned dynamically by a table column value.

color.title: Section Color
color.description: Should be a chosen constant and usually not be assigned dynamically by a table column value.

pivot.title: Pivot Column
pivot.description: You can specify a column in the input data to autogenerate dataseries for each distinct entry in this column. E.g. if you have a table with columns [city, timestamp, temperature] and specify 'city' as pivot column, then you will get a doughnut for each city.
